job_description: About the job Our client, UNIPCO, is seeking a Data Specialist to join their dynamic team based in Moncton, NB.  UNIPCO is a unique, 100% member-owned foodservice buying group in Canada, dedicated to empowering independent foodservice operators. By joining UNIPCO, members gain access to invaluable services that are typically out of reach for independents. These services include negotiated pricing, significant manufacturer rebates, price monitoring, and comprehensive operational support. UNIPCO’s mission is to boost the profitability of its members, helping them save both time and money. Join UNIPCO and become part of a network that truly levels the playing field for independent foodservice operators.  Reporting to the President & CEO, the Data Specialist will be responsible for processing data and helping with rebate claims for clients. Additionally, you’ll leverage your organizational skills to complete monthly bank reconciliations and other office responsibilities as required.  Qualifications and key competencies: A minimum two years of related work experience in a similar field. Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills. Experience and/or exposure to finance software. Innovative and tech-savvy individual who is open to exploring new solutions and operational approaches. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal. You have experience or an interest in marketing and social media. Bilingualism in French and English is an asset.  This is a full-time in-office position with regular office hours based in Moncton, NB. UNIPCO offers a competitive compensation package, including health benefits and a retirement savings program. This is a fantastic opportunity for the right individual to leave a lasting mark in an exciting industry!  For more information or to easily submit your resume, send an email to julie@teamjmc.ca or call 506.870.0682.   We thank all interested applicants, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
why_this_company: UNIPCO’s mission to empower independent foodservice operators by providing them access to unparalleled services, such as negotiated pricing and comprehensive operational support, deeply resonates with me. Their dedication to boosting the profitability of their members aligns perfectly with my passion for leveraging data to drive business success. Moreover, UNIPCO's reputation as a member-owned cooperative that levels the playing field in the foodservice industry is truly inspiring. The opportunity to join a dynamic team that values innovation and supports its members with exceptional benefits makes me eager to contribute to UNIPCO’s continued growth and success.
why_me: With over two years of experience as a Data Analyst, I bring robust analytical skills and a proficient command of Python, Power BI, and AWS, which are essential for the Data Specialist role at UNIPCO. My past achievements include enhancing decision-making accuracy by 15% through predictive modeling and automating data processing workflows, which improved efficiency by 40%. My experience with crafting tailored Power BI dashboards and my collaborative nature align well with UNIPCO’s needs. I am passionate about the foodservice industry and eager to drive profitability for independent operators. I look forward to discussing how I can contribute to UNIPCO while aiming to perfect my homemade pizza recipe!

job_description: About the job ROLE OBJECTIVE:  Reporting to the Insights Director, the Insights Analyst is responsible for bringing together Environics Analytics (EA) data, software and services to execute client projects. These projects may include customer profiling, creating custom target segments, developing personas, and other similar activities using EA’s core data, analytics platforms, and segmentation approaches. Given that a significant portion of the Insights Analyst’s time will be spent creating client-facing work (generally PowerPoint presentations), this individual must be very detail-oriented, have excellent verbal and written communication skills, and have a strong client service orientation. There are elements of this role that are client-facing.  SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:  To effectively fulfill the responsibilities of this position, the employee must be able to:  Summarize data in tables and charts, interpret the data, look for relevant insights and write reports supporting client objectives.  Prepare and present PowerPoint presentations to communicate research results effectively.  Manage projects from start to finish, managing timelines while maintaining high quality.  Participate in client meetings and assist in identifying client needs; help recommend solutions from EA’s data, software, and services to meet those needs.   In conjunction with the Account Manager and Client Services team, educate, train and support key clients on EA’s data and tools; answer any client questions about the data or other deliverables received.  Work closely with other staff in Sales, Account Management, Data Solutions, and other teams to meet client requirements.  Communicate opportunities for more effective and efficient workflow/processes to the Director of Insights and/or the Account Manager (as relevant).  Other duties as required.   _____________________________________________________________________  QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIRED SKILLS: Education – Post-secondary degree in Geography, Social Sciences, Business or a related field Experience – 1 – 3 years of experience (or equivalent summer experience) at EA or in a related field Client Focus – Dedicated to setting and meeting the expectations and requirements of clients and acts with the client in mind. Establishes effective relationships and gains and maintains the trust and respect of clients.  Analytical Skills – Effectively synthesizes complex or diverse information. Uses sound judgement to complement data-based insight, supporting and explaining the reasoning for decisions.  Time Management – Demonstrates strong time management skills, ensuring all tasks are completed efficiently and deadlines met.  Planning/Organizing – Effectively prioritizes and plans work activities and demonstrates the ability to multi-task.  Flexible – Adaptable to changing priorities. Willing to adjust to new processes and take on new challenges as they arise.  Results-Oriented – Focused on delivering high-quality work product to clients professionally and promptly.  Communication Skills – Able to communicate ideas and expectations. Effectively listens for understanding and asks questions for clarification. Presents ideas effectively in both verbal and written form.  Interpersonal Skills – Approachable and easy to talk to. Relates well to all kinds of people in the organization, particularly with others in Insights and the Sales department. Able to effectively build rapport with others.  Presentation Skills – Able to create and deliver informative, compelling presentations that capture and keep the audience’s attention in person and via online meetings.  Technical Skills – Expertise in all Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and facility with other software applications, including EA’s proprietary ENVISION product. Working knowledge of Tableau and PowerBIis a plus.  Teamwork – Balances team and individual responsibilities. Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views, giving and welcoming feedback.  Innovation – Generates suggestions for improving the effectiveness and efficiency of workflows and deliverables.   ABOUT ENVIRONICS ANALYTICS:  Environics Analytics (EA) is a marketing services company specializing in geodemographic-based segmentation, site evaluation modelling, and custom analytics. At EA, you will solve meaningful and challenging tasks with a friendly team of the most brilliant minds. We hire personality, not just a pair of hands. Here you're free to express your unique qualities and explore different domains and technologies that interest you.   EA is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Please note the request in your application if you require any accommodation to participate in the hiring process. We welcome people of all abilities.   We enjoy working on-site and spending time with our team. We have a Hybrid work model. We look forward to working with you in our fantastic office, located in Toronto at 33 Bloor Street East , two days per week. Great coffee is on us!
why_this_company: Environics Analytics' (EA) commitment to using geodemographic-based segmentation and custom analytics is a key factor that draws me to this role. I am impressed by EA's comprehensive suite of data, software, and services designed to provide valuable insights and drive decision-making for clients. The company's reputation for innovation and its inclusive, team-oriented culture is highly appealing. EA's mission to leverage data to solve complex marketing challenges aligns perfectly with my passion for using data to tell compelling stories. Their hybrid work model also supports a balanced professional environment, which excites me about the possibility of contributing to their diverse and talented team.
why_me: With over two years of experience as a Data Analyst, I bring a strong background in data visualization, machine learning, and big data analysis, which are pivotal for the Insights Analyst role at Environics Analytics. My accomplishments include enhancing sales projections by 15% through predictive modeling and boosting data processing efficiency by 40% with custom Python scripts for ETL automation. My technical expertise in Power BI, Tableau, and Python, paired with a client-focused mindset and strong presentation skills, aligns well with EA’s requirements. I am passionate about leveraging data for strategic insights and look forward to discussing how I can contribute to EA's success—ideally before I perfect my homemade pizza recipe!

job_description: About the job Company Description  The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto Rehabilitation Institute and the Michener Institute of Education. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of ground breaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.  Job Description  Union: Non-Union  Site: OPG, 700 University Ave  Department: Radiation Medicine Department  Reports to: Manager, Program Development & Strategic Partnerships  Work Model: On-Site  Grade: H04  Hours: 37.5m hours/week  Salary: To commensurate with experience and consistent with UHN compensation policy  Shifts: Day Shift  Status: Temporary Full-time. One year contract.  Closing Date: July 26, 2024  The Radiation Medicine Program (RMP) at the Princess Margaret Cancer Centre is seeking a self-motivated, detail-oriented Data Analyst to join the Radiation and Analytics Team. The incumbent will work under the Manager, Program Development and Strategic Partnerships and collaboratively with the RMP Data Analytics Lead, bringing their expertise in analysis, communication, and problem-solving to understand the needs of the department.  The principal responsibilities include: analysis, interpretation, and reporting of information; data analysis using tools such as Excel, Power BI, SQL, etc; reviewing historical reports and creating up-to-date documentation; proposing new and unique ideas to approach reporting and/or data visualization; communicating with internal and external stakeholders; an interest in project management techniques and their application; and performing administrative/coordination activities, as required.  Position Summary  This role will focus on gathering information from a variety of stakeholders to understand the data needs, landscape, and possibilities and using sound logic, developing wireframes for routine reporting and dashboards. The incumbent will need to be a clear and effective communicator, open to iterative design and feedback.  Duties  Analysis, interpretation, and reporting of information. Data analysis with tools such as Excel, Power BI, SQL, or R. Consultation with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose wireframes for reports and/or dashboards. Proposes new and unique ideas to approach reporting and/or data request needs, including possibilities for visualization. Creates up-to-date documentation and records. Carefully evaluates pros/cons of solutions and proposes appropriate decisions/solutions. Provides updates on tasks via status reports in written, verbal, or graphical form. Implements results of projects into regular workflow, including regular team updates and meeting project timelines.   Qualifications  Bachelor degree in Science, Business, or a related discipline. A minimum of one year practical, related experience in data analysis. Experience with data tasks like analysis, report creation, and visualization. Experience with data analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, SQL, R, or Python. Ability to break down a complex problem into smaller parts and solve using logic. Excellent verbal and written communication skills required. Ability to set priorities, stay organized, and meet deadlines required.   Additional Information  Why join UHN?  In addition to working alongside some of the most talented and inspiring healthcare professionals in the world, UHN offers a wide range of benefits, programs and perks. It is the comprehensiveness of these offerings that makes it a differentiating factor, allowing you to find value where it matters most to you, now and throughout your career at UHN.  Competitive offer packages Government organization and a member of the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP https://hoopp.com/) Close access to Transit and UHN shuttle service A flexible work environment Opportunities for development and promotions within a large organization Additional perks (multiple corporate discounts including: travel, restaurants, parking, phone plans, auto insurance discounts, on-site gyms, etc.)   Current UHN employees must have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, to be eligible for consideration.  All applications must be submitted before the posting close date.  UHN uses email to communicate with selected candidates. Please ensure you check your email regularly.  Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any information provided by a candidate be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, UHN reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of their application.  UHN is an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive recruitment process and workplace. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process. Applicants need to make their requirements known.  We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
why_this_company: The University Health Network’s mission to put the needs of patients first and its vision to transform lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery, and learning resonate deeply with my personal and professional values. The network’s breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise make it a national and international leader in patient care, research, and education. I am particularly drawn to UHN’s reputation for groundbreaking firsts and its collaborative and innovative culture. The organization’s dedication to continuous learning and development strongly aligns with my career aspirations, offering a dynamic environment where I can grow and contribute to impactful healthcare solutions. I am excited about the opportunity to join a team that champions excellence and creativity in healthcare.
why_me: With over two years of experience as a Data Analyst, I bring robust analytical skills and proficiency in Python, SQL, and Power BI, which are crucial for the Data Analyst role at UHN. My notable achievements include creating a predictive model that enhanced sales projection accuracy by 15%, optimizing data processing workflows by 40%, and developing tailored Power BI dashboards that improved strategic planning. My technical expertise, combined with a collaborative and problem-solving mindset, aligns perfectly with UHN’s needs. I am passionate about leveraging data to drive healthcare innovation and am eager to bring my skills to UHN, hoping to master pizza-making before our interview call.

job_description: About the job Company Description  The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, West Park Healthcare Centre and the Michener Institute of Education. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of ground breaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.  Job Description  Union: Non-Union  Site: Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital  Department: UHN Data & Analytics  Reports to: Program Manager, Performance Improvement & Excellence  Work Model: Hybrid  Grade: H0:06  Hours: 37.5 per week  Salary: $69,872 to $87,341 annually (To commensurate with experience and consistent with UHN compensation policy)  Status: Permanent Full-Time  Closing Date: August 3, 2024  Position Summary  UHN Data & Analytics supports UHN’s growing demand for data, data-driven insights and helps TeamUHN ensure the needs of the patients come first. Our collective goal is to better see, understand and use data to help UHN become a data-driven organization, which will help us achieve UHN’s strategic goals and ultimately advance care, research, and education. UHN Data & Analytics supports UHN in data-driven decisions, data literacy, performance improvement, data governance, data infrastructure/tools, advanced analytics, and automation.  The Performance Improvement & Excellence (PIE) team works under the direction of the Director and the Chief Data & Analytics Officer to foster a data-driven culture and learning health system. Working closely with clinical and administrative stakeholders, the PIE team helps identify complex issues and implement innovative solutions to improve quality, operational efficiency, and patient safety across various clinical programs. With expertise in data analytics and relationship management.  The Analytics Specialist is responsible for developing insights through analytics and ensuring cross-functional alignment across operations, data reporting, and planning. Ultimately helping drive innovative initiatives, informing corporate priorities, and evaluating program outcomes.  Duties  Prepare and present data as a meaningful story for stakeholders in a visually appealing manner.  Assist in developing and reporting on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) related to clinical, quality, and operational metrics.  Collaborate with different departments to gather, manipulate, interpret, and analyze data for monitoring and optimizing organizational performance.  Communicate complex technical information in written reports for diverse audiences.  Assist in interpreting results and preparing materials for presentations.  Engage relevant clinical, business and leadership teams to understand problems and current state and identify opportunities for improvement.  Document data analysis processes, methodologies, and findings for reference and knowledge sharing.   Qualifications  Undergraduate Degree in Health Informatics, Public Health, Computer Science, Business or related field.  Minimum 1 year of relevant experience in a healthcare environment supporting analytics, dashboards, business processes, simulation, and reporting or equivalent.  Experience designing and developing dashboards, visualizations, routine and ad-hoc reports from multiple datasets. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to systematically analyze situations, identify issues and patterns, then draw logical conclusions.  Well-formed organizational, time management, communication, and decision-making skills.  Knowledge of trends, strategic frameworks, and advances in data and analytics capabilities, considered an asset. Experience with programming (JavaScript, R, Python, SQL, MS Azure), and simulation software (e.g. Simul8) considered an asset.   Additional Information  Why join UHN?  In addition to working alongside some of the most talented and inspiring healthcare professionals in the world, UHN offers a wide range of benefits, programs and perks. It is the comprehensiveness of these offerings that makes it a differentiating factor, allowing you to find value where it matters most to you, now and throughout your career at UHN.  Competitive offer packages Government organization and a member of the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP https://hoopp.com/) Close access to Transit and UHN shuttle service A flexible work environment Opportunities for development and promotions within a large organization Additional perks (multiple corporate discounts including: travel, restaurants, parking, phone plans, auto insurance discounts, on-site gyms, etc.)   Current UHN employees must have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, to be eligible for consideration.  Vaccines (COVID and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.  UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process. Applicants need to make their requirements known in advance. Any information received related to an accommodation will be addressed confidentially.  University Health Network thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  All applications must be submitted before the posting close date.  UHN uses email to communicate with selected candidates. Please ensure you check your email regularly.  Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any information provided by a candidate be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, UHN reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of their application.  UHN is an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive recruitment process and workplace. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process. Applicants need to make their requirements known.  We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
why_this_company: University Health Network's (UHN) mission to transform lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery, and learning is incredibly inspiring. UHN's comprehensive network, including Toronto General Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, and the Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, positions it as a leader in patient care, research, and education. The organization's reputation for groundbreaking medical firsts and its commitment to a culture of innovation align perfectly with my career aspirations in data analytics and performance improvement. UHN’s inclusive workplace and emphasis on professional development present exciting growth opportunities, and I am thrilled at the prospect of contributing to an organization that prioritizes patients’ needs above all else.
why_me: With over two years of experience as a Data Analyst, I bring a robust set of analytical skills and hands-on proficiency in Python, SQL, and Power BI, aligning well with the needs of the Analytics Specialist role at UHN. Among my achievements is the development of a machine learning model that improved sales forecast accuracy by 15%, demonstrating my ability to derive impactful insights from complex data. My experience with ETL automation and dashboard creation further underscores my suitability for assisting UHN in performance improvement and data-driven decision-making. Passionate about healthcare and data analytics, I am enthusiastic about the opportunity to contribute to UHN’s mission, and I hope to perfect my homemade pizza recipe before our interview!

job_description: About the job The Data Analyst, Data & Analytics will be a key member of the TSP Data Strategy and Analytics team. The incumbent will be responsible for supporting the finance department in all their reporting needs. They will be working on various aspects of data projects and business projects that have a data component documenting technical standards and best practices. This role is responsible for documenting, delivering, and maintaining ad-hoc reporting and data specifications and practice of applications following the introduction of new projects. They will also be responsible of maintaining operations running, especially during month end process. This is to be accomplished by adhering to TSP data architecture governance and standards to ensure a high-quality analysis is maintained throughout. The incumbent will constantly update the practices to enhance the evolution of our data ecosystem.  This position will work directly with the finance groups which includes FP&A, AR/AP, Project Analysis, Payroll and General Accounting. They will help provide insights and findings using data, reporting, and analysis. Additionally, we are looking for someone who can analyze data and possibly make recommendations on improvements or insight into possible issues. This person may also use charting and diagraming tools to collect, document, share, and or review ideas or processes through their course of work.  Reporting  This position will be reporting to the Senior Data Analyst and Data Governance.  Key Functions  Design, build, deliver and maintain user-friendly reporting and analytics insights for the finance business domain using modern data analytics best practices and tools. Move legacy reports to our modern data analytics practices and tools. Develop an in-depth understanding on various finance processes and develop ways to improve current state of data delivery by providing innovative solutions.  Convert conceptual customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to technical and non-technical audiences. Help develop the data roadmap and features in a way that aligns and supports current and future finance needs. Analyze legacy reporting challenges and help design modern solutions that will support our data strategy and architecture short-term and long-term goals. Act as data steward to ensure that the data governance processes are being followed. Ensure the quality and fitness for purpose of the organization's data assets is up to date. Ensure the metadata assets (data dictionaries and data mappings) are up to date. Ensure that the users are adhering to the data requirements processes. Produce daily/weekly/monthly operational reports as per committed timeliness. Support process improvements for the Data Analytics team at TSP. Design report visualizations (including charts and graphs). Develop standard reports, and processes to keep critical metrics in line (financial and operational broken down by key areas). Maintain files operational by debugging, reverse-engineering, and communicating when needed with other IT teams. Generate customized analysis and reporting, examining the effectiveness of TSP. Determine root cause for data integrity gaps and provide appropriate data resolution and process remedy solutions. Develop innovative and effective approaches to solve business problems through data analytics approaches and communicate results and methodologies. Define and document data dependencies and data flow diagrams of the solution developed. Initiate data analysis and identify strategic opportunities that creates a positive impact on business. Work closely with relevant stakeholders to collect and use information for improved business and operational performance. Responsible for actively supporting the development and enhancement of processes, priorities, and goals for a functional area. Help identify gaps by each department so the teams can address key areas of focus or reporting/analytics needed. Analyze data to identify problematic areas and suggest improvements. Manage the backlog of daily data requests so they stay organized.  Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, Accounting) 1+ years business and data analyst experience (preferably in finance) Working knowledge of BI and data warehouse concepts and terminology Very strong Excel skills including advanced formulas and macros Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, modeling, verification, and methodology development Capable of prioritizing multiple projects while still achieving deadlines Detail-oriented, passionate about quality and enthusiastic about new technology Strong communication, collaboration, organization, and planning skills Self-motivated and able to work independently Familiar with data quality and metadata management practices and tools Ability to work effectively under pressure and in rapidly changing environments or uncertain conditions 1 years of IT technology or operations experience in a large company 1 years of experience gathering requirements from business stakeholders 2 years of experience using SQL to gather, clean and analyze data 1+ Years of Experience with dashboarding and visualization tools like Power BI, Domo, Tableau, Looker or similar platforms. A relevant University degree/technical certification, and/or relevant experience commensurate to the role Able to approach a problem by using a logical, systematic, sequential approach. Strong analytical skills, using a combination of tools Strong understanding of accounting procedures Ability to learn and share knowledge with other team members Nice to have: Experience with Snowflake, dbt and other modern analytic tools Certifications in Big Data Hadoop, Data Management and Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence What We Offer  A commitment that Safety is #1 Competitive benefits, pay, and retirement plan options! Career growth, stability, and flexible work arrangements.  Responsible Manufacturing – Protecting Our Planet for the Future  We utilize renewable energy and a closed loop recycled water process. We are committed to reducing greenhouse emissions and water consumption. We are the only flooring company recognized by the Asthma and Allergy foundation.  Who we are:  With a history of 140 years, Tarkett is a worldwide leader in innovative flooring and sport surface solutions with 12,000 employees and 34 industrial sites. Offering a wide range of products including vinyl, linoleum, rubber, carpet, wood, laminate, artificial turf, and athletic tracks. The Group serves customers in more than 100 countries across the globe.  Committed to change the game with circular economy and to reducing its carbon footprint, the Group has implemented an eco-innovation strategy based on Cradle to Cradle® principles, fully aligned with its Tarkett Human-Conscious Design® approach.  Tarkett is listed on Euronext (Compartment B, ISIN FR0004188670, ticker: TKTT). www.tarkett-group.com  Tarkett is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity in backgrounds and in experiences and promote an inclusive workplace where all employees can perform at their best.
why_this_company: Tarkett’s commitment to sustainability and innovative products in the flooring industry is a major factor that draws me to this position. With its eco-innovation strategy and use of renewable energy, Tarkett not only leads in market solutions but also puts environmental responsibility at the forefront, which aligns perfectly with my values. The company's global reach and diverse product range in over 100 countries provide a robust platform for growth and learning. I am particularly impressed by Tarkett’s dedication to reducing its carbon footprint and implementing Cradle to Cradle® principles. The opportunity to contribute to a company renowned for its high standards in quality and sustainability is incredibly exciting, and I am eager to bring my data analytics expertise to support Tarkett’s mission and continued innovation.
why_me: With over two years of experience as a Data Analyst, I bring proven expertise in data analytics, particularly with tools like Python, SQL, and Power BI that are essential to the Junior Data Analyst role at Tarkett. My accomplishments include developing predictive models that improved sales projection accuracy by 15% and optimizing data workflows for enhanced efficiency by 30%. My strong analytical skills and experience in automating data-driven insights align seamlessly with Tarkett’s needs for enhancing reporting, analysis, and strategic decision-making. Being passionate about data science and sustainability, I am enthusiastic about contributing to Tarkett’s innovative approach and supporting its data strategy to drive growth. I look forward to discussing my fit for this role, ideally before perfecting my homemade pizza recipe!

job_description: About the job UNCAGE YOUR AMBITION  as a  Data Analyst    We are FlightHub Group , an ambitious team of people that created FlightHub and Justfly . Our brands have grown to become two of the top-ranked travel agencies in North America. We now serve over 3 million customers per year, totaling 3 billion dollars in sales, and, whereas the pandemic may have slowed us down a little, we are coming back even stronger. We dream big, pursue passionately, and follow through with resolute self-belief and rigorous commitment. We are a group of individuals sharing a common vision and values, having come together to pursue a collective mission: overtaking the #1 spot in the world.  We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join our Customer Service department, who has strong analytical skills and experience in SQL, Excel, and Google Sheets. In this role, you will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and performing manual quality assurance (QA) tasks to validate data accuracy.  Key Responsibilities  Collect, process, and analyze data to generate insightful reports. Develop strategies for conducting manual QA efficiently and ensuring data accuracy, quality, and completeness. Generate comprehensive documentation of QA processes and findings. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. Work with management to prioritize business and information needs. Locate and define new process improvement opportunities. Collaborate with other departments to ensure data integrity and consistency.  Qualifications  Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role. Proficient in SQL, with the ability to write complex queries and optimize them for performance. Advanced skills in Excel, including the use of formulas, pivot tables, and data visualization tools. Experience with Google Sheets, including functions and collaboration features. Basic understanding of AI concepts and applications is required. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Strong communication skills to effectively convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders. Familiarity with statistical software and data analysis techniques is a plus. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field.  Soft Skills  Attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize tasks.  Please note this position is in Montreal, Quebec and on-site  Show us your drive and join our team!  Check us out https://flighthubgroup.com/takeoff  LIBÉREZ VOTRE AMBITION – DEVENEZ  Analyste de données  Nous sommes le groupe FlightHub, nous formons une équipe ambitieuse derrière les agences de voyages en ligne FlightHub et Justfly. Nos marques sont devenues deux des agences de voyages en ligne les plus importantes en Amérique du Nord. Nous servons maintenant plus de trois millions de clients par année, et générons au-delà de trois milliards de dollars de ventes, et, même si la pandémie nous a un peu ralenti, l'industrie des voyages recommence à montrer des signes de vie, et le moment est propice pour vous joindre à nous parce que nous en profitons pour revenir encore plus forts. Nous rêvons en grand, nous poursuivons nos objectifs avec passion, et nous avons confiance en notre habilité à les atteindre.  Nous recherchons un analyste de données qualifié pour rejoindre notre service clientèle, qui possède de solides compétences analytiques et de l'expérience en SQL, Excel et Google Sheets. Dans ce rôle, vous serez responsable de l'interprétation des données, de l'analyse des résultats à l'aide de techniques statistiques et de l'exécution de tâches manuelles d'assurance qualité (QA) pour valider l'exactitude des données.  Principales Responsabilités  Collecter, traiter et analyser les données afin de produire des rapports pertinents. Élaborer des stratégies pour mener efficacement des tâches manuelles d'assurance qualité et garantir l'exactitude, la qualité et l'exhaustivité des données. Produire une documentation complète sur les processus et les résultats de l'assurance qualité. Identifier, analyser et interpréter les tendances ou les modèles dans des ensembles de données complexes. Collaborer avec la direction pour hiérarchiser les besoins en matière d'activités et d'informations. Localiser et définir de nouvelles possibilités d'amélioration des processus. Collaborer avec d'autres services pour garantir l'intégrité et la cohérence des données.  Qualifications  Expérience confirmée en tant qu'analyste de données ou dans un rôle similaire. Maîtrise du langage SQL, avec la capacité d'écrire des requêtes complexes et de les optimiser en termes de performances. Compétences avancées en Excel, y compris l'utilisation de formules, de tableaux croisés dynamiques et d'outils de visualisation de données. Solides compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes et capacité à faire preuve d'esprit critique. Capacité à travailler de manière indépendante et en équipe. job_description: About the job Vivier Pharma is a Canadian Pharmaceutical Skin Care company with over 20 years of experience in the Medical Aesthetic Industry. We are currently looking for an E-Commerce Data Analyst to join our team based out of our Vaudreuil-Dorion head office.  The E-Commerce Data Analyst will be responsible for building dashboards and providing in-depth analytics on the Company’s B2C business in both Canada and the US. In addition, they will support the Digital Marketing Team with insights about e-commerce sales performance, customer demographics and campaign performance by improving current data analytics to help drive strategic direction and future business decisions. This is a permanent, full time hybrid position.  What we offer  Competitive salary and vacation Hybrid position - working both in-office and at home Full benefits, including telemedicine, EAP, Health Care Spending Account and Wellness Account RRSP company matching contributions Paid personal/sick days Free product allowance Social events and recognition programs And most importantly…a fun team and great environment to work in!  What you will be responsible for  Dashboards / Benchmarks: Analyze current methods of reporting data and recommend changes and/or tools to increase reporting efficiency Develop and maintain e-commerce dashboards for tracking and consolidating data from online activity across various platforms Build, enhance and run ad hoc and re-occurring reports, to highlight current and historical B2C customer and sales tends Develop processes to streamline and optimize data analysis  Analysis / Data: Analyze online sales and website performance data to identify trends, patters, and areas for improvement Present data analytics to key stakeholders Manage data sources by ensuring accurate Urchin Tracking Module (UTM) parameters, tracking pixels etc. Work with agencies on analytics and tracking related to agency led projects Utilize knowledge and experience to help develop strategic business decisions  What are we looking for  Bachelor’s or College Degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, Information Technology or equivalent experience Minimum three (3) years of previous experience in a similar role Experience in aesthetics/skin care or beauty industry is preferred Strong understanding of data tracking, UTM parameters and attribution models Detail oriented, with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills The ability to present data in a clear and concise manner through strong communication Proficient in digital analytical tools such as Google Analytics Strong understanding of Shopify/E-commerce platforms, trends and technologies Proficient in Microsoft Office – Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint English language proficiency is required for this job  If you are up for this exciting challenge and want to be part of a winning team, we would like to hear from you!  Vivier Pharma is an equal opportunity employer.  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Vivier Pharma est une société pharmaceutique canadienne de soins de la peau qui compte plus de 20 ans d'expérience dans l'industrie de l'esthétique médicale. Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d'un analyste des données sur le commerce électronique pour se joindre à notre équipe basée à notre siège social de Vaudreuil-Dorion.  L’analyste des données sur le commerce électronique sera chargé de créer des tableaux de bord et de mener des analyses approfondies sur les activités de commerce électronique de détail (CED) menées par l’entreprise au Canada et aux États-Unis. De plus, il ou elle appuiera l’équipe du marketing numérique en lui fournissant des connaissances sur le rendement des ventes en ligne, les profils démographiques des clients, et le rendement des campagnes commerciales en améliorant les processus actuels d’analyse des données afin d’aider à définir la direction stratégique et à orienter les décisions commerciales. Il s'agit d'un poste hybride permanent à temps plein.  Ce que nous offrons  Salaire et vacances compétitifs Poste hybride - travaille au bureau et à la maison Avantages complets, y compris télémédecine, PAE, compte de dépenses de soins de santé et compte de bien-être Équilibre du REER de l'entreprise Journées personnelles/de maladie payées Allocation pour produits gratuits Événements sociaux et programmes de reconnaissance Et le plus important... une équipe amusante et un environnement de travail formidable !  Ce dont vous serez responsable  Tableaux de bord / références : Analyser les méthodes actuelles de signalement des données et recommander des changements et (ou) des outils pour rendre la production de rapports plus efficace Élaborer et maintenir des tableaux de bord sur le commerce électronique afin de suivre et de consolider les données sur les activités en ligne à travers diverses plates-formes Élaborer, améliorer et exécuter des rapports ponctuels et récurrents qui font ressortir les tendances actuelles et historiques relatives aux clients et aux ventes du commerce électronique de détail Élaborer des processus pour simplifier et optimiser l’analyse des données  Analyse / données : Analyser des données sur le rendement des ventes en ligne et du site Web afin de relever des tendances, des profils, et des secteurs à améliorer Présenter les analyses de données aux intervenants clés Gérer les sources de données en assurant la précision des paramètres UTM (module de suivi Urchin), des pixels espions, etc. Collaborer avec les agences dans le cadre des analyses et du suivi liés aux projets menés par ces mêmes agences Utiliser ses connaissances et son expérience pour aider à élaborer des décisions commerciales stratégiques  Ce que nous recherchons  Baccalauréat ou diplôme d’études collégiales en administration des affaires, en marketing, en communications, en technologies de l’information, ou expérience équivalente Minimum de trois (3) ans d’expérience dans des fonctions semblables Une expérience dans les secteurs de l’esthétique, des soins de la peau ou des produits de beauté est souhaitable Excellente compréhension du suivi des données, des paramètres UTM et des modèles d’attribution Souci du détail et excellentes compétences en analyse et en résolution de problèmes Capacité de présenter les données d’une manière claire et concise grâce à d’excellentes aptitudes de communication Maîtrise d’outils d’analyse numériques, comme Google Analytics Solide compréhension des plates-formes Shopify/du commerce électronique, ainsi que des tendances et technologies connexes Maîtrise de Microsoft Office - Outlook, Word, Excel et PowerPoint Une grande aisance en anglais est requise pour ce poste  Si vous êtes prêt à relever ce défi passionnant et que vous souhaitez faire partie d'une équipe gagnante, nous aimerions vous entendre !  Vivier Pharma est un employeur offrant l'égalité des chances.  Afin d’alléger le texte, l’emploi du genre masculin pour désigner tant les femmes que les hommes ont été privilégié.

job_description: About the job Company Description  Position Summary  Founded in 2005, Value Partners Investments (VPI) is a Winnipeg-based investment firm that currently manages over $4.7 Billion in assets primarily through nine investment funds as well as through Value Partners Investment Counsel (VPIC) which provides discretionary investment management services to wealthy families across Canada.  Our mission is to build client wealth by investing wisely and communicating clearly. Over the past 18 years we have fulfilled that mission by creating over $1.8 Billion in investment gains for clients. This track record of success has enabled us to become one of Canada’s fastest growing companies as ranked by Profit Magazine and one of Canada’s fastest growing Private Investment Counsels by Investor Economics.  Reporting to the Director of Information Technology, the Data Analyst plays a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights for our organization. Your work will empower decision-makers by providing clear visualizations and reports. You will collaborate with various stakeholders to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams.  The Data Analyst is a key member of the IT team who collaborates daily with various internal stakeholders of the business while understanding our products and services within the financial services industry and VPI’s place in it. Internally to VPI this also means living VPI’s investment philosophy, our products, our values and supporting our strategic direction.  , Job Description  Key Responsibilities:  Collaboration: Work closely with business teams to understand requirements and translate them into meaningful visualizations.  Metric Definition: Lead the process to define and document the definitions of key metrics required by stakeholders.  Data Analysis: Analyze data, identify trends, and uncover patterns to drive informed business decisions.  Power BI Development: Leverage Microsoft’s Power BI to create interactive dashboards and reports.  Data Modeling: Work with the Senior Data Architect to design and develop data models that effectively support business requirements.  Accuracy and Reliability: Ensure the accuracy and reliability of data presented in dashboards and reports.  Effective Communication: Clearly convey complex data insights to stakeholders.  Power BI Adoption: Train and support staff on the use of Power BI Business Intelligence: Contribute to the organization’s data-driven strategy built on Microsoft Fabric.  Other miscellaneous duties and special projects as assigned.   , Qualifications  Education & Experience:  Diploma or degree in a related field.  A minimum of 2-3 years working with diverse BI tools, with expertise in Microsoft Power BI. Experience with other components of Microsoft Fabric considered an asset.  A combination of education and experience will be considered.   Technical Skills:  SQL, Nice -To-Have: Proficiency in programming languages such as R and Python.  Strong knowledge of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and M (Power Query) scripting languages.  Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI).   Skills & Abilities:  Excellent time management and adaptability.  Strong verbal and written communication skills Exceptional attention to detail Ability to manage multiple tasks.  Proven analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills  Additional Information  Comprehensive health, dental and vision benefits  Health & Wellness Spending Account  4% Matching RRSP allocation  Great workplace culture!

job_description: About the job Company Description  The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto Rehabilitation Institute and the Michener Institute of Education. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of ground breaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.  Job Description  Union: Non-Union  Site: Toronto General Hospital; There is occasional travel associated with this position between UHN hospital sites in the downtown Toronto core  Department: UHN Data & Analytics  Reports to: Manager, Data Strategy & Governance  Work Model: Hybrid  Grade: H0:06  Hours: 37.5 per week  Salary: $69,872 to $87,341 annually (To commensurate with experience and consistent with UHN compensation policy)  Status: Permanent Full-Time  Closing Date: July 27, 2024  Position Summary  UHN Data & Analytics enables UHN in transformative, measurable and data-informed healthcare improvement. We support the lifecycle of data and analytics at the organization, and advance capabilities through collaboration across the organization.  Within UHN Data & Analytics, the Data Strategy, Governance & Analytics Team seeks to establish data governance, advance data literacy, and leverage predictive and simulation-based analytics to address care and operational challenges.  The Business Process & Data Analyst plays a critical role in implementing strategic initiatives that unlock the value of UHN's data assets.  Duties  Research and incorporate trends, best practices, and literature into impactful and innovative solutions Plan and conduct requirements gathering, workflow/data mapping, and application testing Support project scoping, scheduling, monitoring, risk assessment, and stakeholder engagement Determine business insights through the collection, assessment, and analysis of complex organizational data Proactively recommend options to address problems and opportunities on projects and the team Produce high quality documentation and deliverables Understand and align with organizational strategy and guidance Learn new tools and techniques relevant to project and operational tasks, including project management, change management, business analysis, data analysis, data governance, and data literacy Lead projects of low risk and small scope   Qualifications  An Undergraduate Degree in Health Informatics, Industrial Engineering, Business, or a related field 1-2 years of related industry experience in program management (planning, implementation, risk assessment, documentation, and benefits realization) Excellent facilitation, inter-personal, and written/oral communications skills Excellent analytical, prioritization, and organization skills Ability to work independently on multiple ongoing priorities successfully in a fast-paced environment Advanced proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Visio, Project, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, and SharePoint)   Additional Information  Why join UHN?  In addition to working alongside some of the most talented and inspiring healthcare professionals in the world, UHN offers a wide range of benefits, programs and perks. It is the comprehensiveness of these offerings that makes it a differentiating factor, allowing you to find value where it matters most to you, now and throughout your career at UHN.  Competitive offer packages Government organization and a member of the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP https://hoopp.com/) Close access to Transit and UHN shuttle service A flexible work environment Opportunities for development and promotions within a large organization Additional perks (multiple corporate discounts including: travel, restaurants, parking, phone plans, auto insurance discounts, on-site gyms, etc.)   Current UHN employees must have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, to be eligible for consideration.  All applications must be submitted before the posting close date.  UHN uses email to communicate with selected candidates. Please ensure you check your email regularly.  Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any information provided by a candidate be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, UHN reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of their application.  UHN is an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive recruitment process and workplace. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process. Applicants need to make their requirements known.  We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

job_position_title: Calgary Based Data Analyst II/III - MFL/GEO Pipeline In-Line Inspection
job_description: About the job Job Type  Full-time  Description  ENTEGRA® is the global leader in Ultra-High Resolution (UHR) pipeline in-line inspection technologies, driving innovation in the realm of pipeline integrity. We are a dynamic and forward-thinking company, driven by experienced and talented individuals, advanced processes, and groundbreaking technology. Our commitment is unwavering as we strive to revolutionize the landscape of in-line inspection, setting new standards for excellence.  The role requires a minimum of 2 years of experience in interpretation of MFL, Geometry and Inertial mapping pipeline inspection data as well as a current ASNT Data Analysis Level II certification.  This is a remote role but will convert to on-site once a Calgary office location is established.   Position Summary  Data Analysis Level II performs all analysis activities including data setup, data searches, feature detection and identification. Perform automated and manual metal loss searches and checking for correct detection and identification of metal loss and dent type anomalies. Creating Preliminary and Final Report documentation.  Responsibilities  Safety shall always be the top priority. Work in a team environment collaborating and sharing knowledge and experiences. Learn the responsibilities and required tasks of a Level III Data Analysis. Completed requirements of Level III Data Analysis and pass evaluations. Prioritize daily tasks ensuring on time delivery of assigned reports. Understanding and compliance of API 1163, ASNT ILI-PQ, and POF is required.  Perform data preparation and processing of ILI data. Evaluate and analyze data that has been acquired during an in-line inspection.  Create and correlate Wall Thickness verification tables. Feature categorization and evaluation, sizing, application of anomaly interaction rules and standard / non-standard analysis. Correlate analysis results to inspection data from previous years. Assist in training data analysis personnel enabling progression through defined competence levels. Performs other assigned tasks. Operational Excellence: Actively participate in continuous improvement initiatives, consistently working towards the achievement of individual and team goals. Additional Duties: Perform all other duties as assigned.  Requirements  Degree or diploma in engineering, science, or technical discipline; or equivalent experience preferred. Minimum 2 years of experience in interpretation MFL, Geometry and Inertial mapping pipeline inspection data. Strong proficiency in Microsoft suite products. Advanced Excel skills. Data Analyst Level II certification.  Strong work ethic with a can-do attitude Advanced proficiency with operating relevant customized and shrink-wrap computer software applications Demonstrated ability to deliver timely, accurate, and complete results Capable of making independent decisions/recommendations which can have immediate, or time dependent consequences associated with pipeline integrity.  Requires a strong ability to sustain focus on one or more tasks while avoiding distractions.  Willingness to handle repetitive tasks. Requires pattern recognition and spatial thinking skill.  Must be customer focused, have excellent attention to detail and a strong ability to work in a team environment. Knowledge of PHMSA Part 192 and 195 regulations, API, NACE and ASME standards and recommended practices is preferred. Demonstrates a commitment to integrating the ENTEGRA® Core Values into daily work and life. — Be Innovative. Be Devoted. Be Honest. Be Accountable. Be Genuine. Be Industrious. Be Stewards. Be Excellent.

I am particularly impressed by ENTEGRA's dedication to safety, operational excellence, and continuous improvement, which resonates with my passion for data-driven innovation. job_description: About the job Are you interested in joining the Toronto Blue Jays Strategy & Analytics Team? This is your chance!   The Toronto Blue Jays are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst.    OVERVIEW  The Business Intelligence Analyst will play a critical role in determining how data and insights are shared across Toronto Blue Jays Business Operations. The Analyst will evaluate and reconfigure existing business intelligence and reporting infrastructure to help support the operations of other departments, including Ticket Sales, Digital Marketing, and Fan Experience. The Analyst will also be responsible for identifying new opportunities to further expand the Blue Jays’ BI & reporting capabilities to help ensure that other teams are making data-driven decisions.  Additionally, the Analyst will work with other members of the Analytics team to design and conduct analyses that help solve challenging business problems. The Analyst will be a proven problem solver and critical thinker, who is able to collaborate with other stakeholders to drive key business outcomes.  This role may be for you if:  You enjoy thinking about how data and insights can be most effectively visualized and communicated to other stakeholders You have a passion for using data and analytics to solve challenging problems You enjoy creating dashboards and data visualizations You love challenging the status quo and thinking “how can we do this better?”   RESPONSIBILITIES  Help determine how data and insights are shared across the Toronto Blue Jays Business Operations team and reconfigure existing business intelligence and reporting infrastructure to bring this vision to life Create dashboards to support data-driven decision-making across Ticket Sales, Digital Marketing, Fan Experience, and various other TBJ departments Automate processes and reports to share KPIs with senior leaders across the business Help guide data strategy and implementation across major systems (e.g., data warehouse, CRM, customer data platform), ensuring that data is reliable and accessible Collaborate with other departments (e.g., Ticket Sales, Digital Marketing) to understand their specific data needs and provide the right tools and analysis to support their operations and decision-making processes Contribute to the growth and development of the Strategy & Analytics team by developing new capabilities and staying up to date on industry trends  QUALIFICATIONS  2+ years experience in business intelligence, data & analytics, or a related field Comfort with manipulating large datasets in Tableau or other data visualization tools to effectively tell stories through data and uncover actionable insights Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with experience performing quantitative analysis to solve challenging problems Exceptional critical thinker with an ability to effectively communicate complex concepts Advanced skills in Excel; familiarity with SQL and statistical programming languages (e.g., R, Python) is a plus Team player with a willingness and curiosity to push past assigned work Baseball knowledge and passion for the game is a plus Legally eligible to work in Canada  WHAT WE OFFER TO YOU  Commitment to our team - we want you to succeed! Ongoing, hands-on training to help you develop your skills Excellent employee discount to use towards Jays gear A unique employment experience working for the only MLB team in Canada   Blue Jays has a strong commitment to diversity, accessibility and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We encourage individuals from underrepresented groups to apply and join us in shaping the future of our club. Together, we will build a team that reflects the richness of the game and the communities that we represent.  Throughout the recruitment process, we are dedicated to working with candidates who have accessibility needs to ensure they have the necessary support to perform at their best. Questions regarding accessibility throughout the recruitment process can be directed to tbj.careers@bluejays.com.

job_description: About the job Depuis plus de 35 ans, la GRICS développe, adapte et soutient la plus vaste gamme de solutions de gestion des données, de même que la gestion scolaire, pédagogique et administrative faites sur mesure pour le monde de l’éducation. Nous sommes fiers d’être la plus importante entreprise en technologie de l’information spécialisée en éducation au Québec   !   Contexte et responsabilités   Relevant du Secteur des solutions en valorisation de données et intégration, vous serez la personne essentielle à la réalisation de solutions en intelligence d’affaires et intelligence artificielle répondant à la vision, les stratégies et les priorités organisationnelles. Vous travaillerez au sein d’équipes fonctionnant avec la méthodologie Agile.  Votre rôle consistera à assurer l’identification des besoins du réseau, collaborer à l’élaboration et à la réalisation de projets en intelligence d’affaires. Vous serez amené à produire des analyses en lien avec différentes sources de données et de collaborer étroitement avec l’équipe technique à la production d’outils d’intelligence d’affaires pour notre clientèle.   Participer, avec les diverses parties prenantes, à la définition de stratégies portant sur les données et leur utilisation à des fins analytiques   ;   Collaborer à la collecte des besoins des utilisateurs et utilisatrices en matière de métriques et d’indicateurs   ;   Analyser, modéliser, développer et tester, des jeux de données, des rapports, des tableaux de bord et des outils d’aide à la décision en mettant en œuvre les pratiques exemplaires en intelligence d’affaires   ;   Effectuer la conception, l’évolution et le suivi d’indicateurs en respectant le cadre normatif qui prévaut dans le domaine de l’éducation   ;   Explorer, proposer, tester ou prototyper de nouveaux incréments des produits en valorisation et visualisation des données   ;   Aider à concevoir des stratégies de test et des plans de tests d’acceptation   ;   Assurer le transfert de connaissances et la documentation de nouvelles solutions   ;   Soutenir les parties prenantes pendant le déploiement de la solution   ;   Effectuer de la veille sur les tendances et les innovations de la gestion des données et identifier les opportunités de valorisation de données, d’évolution de produits et de développement de nouveaux produits   ;   Assurer une veille technologique   ;   Accomplir toutes autres tâches liées au poste.     Votre profil    Détenir un diplôme terminal d’études universitaires de deuxième cycle dans un champ de spécialisation approprié (tels qu’en intelligence d’affaires, intelligence artificielle en informatique, en actuariat, en mathématique ou en démographie & statistiques, technologie de l’information, ingénierie, administration) ou   ;   Détenir un diplôme terminal d’études universitaires de premier cycle combiné à une certification complémentaire ou   ;   Détenir une formation équivalente et pertinente au domaine d’expertise, tels que : certificat analytique d’affaires, certifications Microsoft en science des données, intelligence d’affaires, intelligence artificielle ou analyse prédictive. Toute formation dans un domaine connexe jumelée à trois (3) années d’expérience pratique sera considérée   ;   Expérience démontrée en intelligence d’affaires, idéalement appliquée au domaine de l’Éducation   ;   Connaissances approfondies de principes entourant les modèles de données multidimensionnels ou tabulaires, les entrepôts de données, les lacs de données   ;   Performance dans la manipulation de grands volumes de données   ;   Capacité éprouvée à travailler sur des programmes complexes et de grandes envergures en matière de données   ;   Connaissances des outils (ou leurs équivalents) : Power BI, ETL/ELT, langages SQL, MDX et DAX   ;   Bonne compréhension des solutions infonuagiques, et des outils de développement Microsoft ou leur équivalent, et du développement en mode SCRUM/Agile   ;   Bonne compréhension de la gouvernance des données et de ses outils   ;   Esprit d’analyse et de logique poussé   ;   Excellente maitrise du français, autant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit   ;   Force dans la gestion de plusieurs priorités simultanément afin d’être en mesure de respecter les échéanciers   ;   Excellente capacité rédactionnelle, tolérance à l’ambiguïté et axé sur les résultats   ;   Très bonne capacité de communication avec les équipes et les partenaires multidisciplinaires tout en décomposant des exigences complexes en sujets tangibles et pertinents   ;   Excellente aptitude pour les relations interpersonnelles et pour le travail d’équipe   ;   Bonne capacité d’adaptation et polyvalence dans votre rôle   ;   Curiosité et facilité pour vous approprier rapidement de nouvelles technologies.     Atouts    Connaissance des produits de la GRICS ou du réseau de l’éducation   ;   Connaissance d’Azure DevOps   ;   Connaissance de l’anglais, autant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit.     Ce que vous offre la GRICS    Un milieu de travail stimulant, humain et convivial   ;   La flexibilité de l’horaire (35 heures) et le télétravail ou mode hybride   ;   Une équipe dynamique de spécialistes   ;   Quatre semaines de vacances annuelles, congés additionnels durant la période des fêtes   ;   D’excellentes conditions de travail incluant un régime de retraite à prestation déterminée   ;   Des défis et de la latitude professionnelle   ;   Et plus encore.     La diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des valeurs importantes pour la GRICS, et nous encourageons toutes les personnes qualifiées à soumettre leur candidature.  Nous remercions toutes les candidates et tous les candidats de l’intérêt porté à la GRICS. Seules les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue  pour une entrevue  seront contactées.

job_description: About the job Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest.  We’re looking for a driven, analytically-minded professional to join the Quantitative Markets team! The Quantitative Markets team is responsible for structuring and pricing Affirm’s debt funding deals, developing platforms and tools for optimizing funding strategies, and building data-driven models to analyze and predict the performance of Affirm’s consumer loans.  The ideal candidate will have prior experience in process automation and optimization as well as development and implementation of quantitative and/or machine learning models. Given the cross-functional nature of the role, the ideal candidate should have strong interpersonal and communication skills.  What You’ll Do  Develop automation tools and optimize existing business processes to enable more efficient pricing and modeling of consumer debt financing deals as well as improve overall efficiency of the team  Advance Affirm’s asset-liability management model to help inform optimal funding strategies and forecast out the economics of our business Build data-driven models to analyze and predict the performance of Affirm’s consumer loans Partner cross-functionally with our Capital Markets, Treasury, Risk, Commercial, Product and Engineering teams to evaluate funding, product, and business decisions   What We Look For  0-3 years of relevant experience in technical areas (e.g. data science, data analytics, quantitative finance).  This position requires either equivalent practical experience or a Bachelor’s degree in a related field Strong data-manipulation and model development and implementation skills using Python Desire to understand the broader context of business decisions Ability to think creatively and critically and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and often ambiguous work environment Strong interpersonal and communication skills, and ability to collaborate and influence across different teams in the organization Experience building quantitative models or implementing machine learning models is a plus  Base Pay Grade - I  Equity Grade - 3  Employees new to Affirm typically come in at the start of the pay range. Affirm focuses on providing a simple and transparent pay structure which is based on a variety of factors, including location, experience and job-related skills.  Base pay is part of a total compensation package that may include monthly stipends for health, wellness and tech spending, and benefits (including 100% subsidized medical coverage, dental and vision for you and your dependents). In addition, the employees may be eligible for equity rewards offered by Affirm Holdings, Inc. (parent company).  CAN base pay range per year: $90,000 - $130,000  Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company! The majority of our roles are remote and you can work almost anywhere within the country of employment. Affirmers in proximal roles have the flexibility to work remotely, but will occasionally be required to work out of their assigned Affirm office. A limited number of roles remain office-based due to the nature of their job responsibilities.  Benefits  We’re extremely proud to offer competitive benefits that are anchored to our core value of people come first. Some key highlights of our benefits package include:   Health care coverage - Affirm covers all premiums for all levels of coverage for you and your dependents   Flexible Spending Wallets - generous stipends for spending on Technology, Food, various Lifestyle needs, and family forming expenses   Time off - competitive vacation and holiday schedules allowing you to take time off to rest and recharge   ESPP - An employee stock purchase plan enabling you to buy shares of Affirm at a discount   We believe It’s On Us to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process.  [For U.S. positions that could be performed in Los Angeles or San Francisco] Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, Affirm will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  By clicking "Submit Application," you acknowledge that you have read the Affirm Employment Privacy Policy for applicants within the United States, the EU Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data (Poland) for applicants applying from Poland, the EU Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data (Spain) for applicants applying from Spain, or the Affirm U.K. Limited Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data for applicants applying from the United Kingdom, and hereby freely and unambiguously give informed consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of your personal information as described therein.
